result.execSummary:
All charges against Daniel Patrick Randall in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Patrick Randall is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Patrick Randall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Patrick Randall in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Daniel Patrick Randall.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for final pretrial.  State does ot have contact with their essential witness.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.  The 9/26/22 jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Daniel Patrick Randall in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  
nnie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Calendar call held.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Atty. Hall requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court informed the parties that good faith negotiation are to be held before the final pretrial and parties should be prepared to inform the Court if the case is going to proceed to trial or if it is going to resolve. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Calendar call scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel Patrick Randall in court with attorney Haley Wentz for Jade K Hall.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Hall is in trial in another court and could not appear.  Atty. Wentz requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TJ, DJ, and SP.

Defendant Daniel Patrick Randall in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/22 @ 1:30p
